page.title: 02INTRO. THE VILLAGES
page.content: very small village composed of a church,a chapel,a school,a small shop ,two rows of terraced cottages and several farms. There was a very small Army establishment at Lodge Hill. With the development of the Hoo Peninsula, especially the huge BP Oil complex at Grain the village grew considerably although it is still a comparatively small village. No further development is permitted at present. Cliffe Woods, the only other village in the block, lies on the north west slope of the escarpment.This village a completely new development of the last few years was created by the demand for housing outside the Medway conurbation. It continues to grow despite opposition from conservationists. A dramatic change came to the area in the mid 1960s when Chattenden Barracks was built.This brought some 400 more
